title: Problem-Based Simulation Education for Enhancing DfAM (Design for Additive Manufacturing) Design Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamentals of 3D modeling, engineering design principles, and basic understanding of manufacturing processes
context.additional_context: Current practitioners conducting projects to solve additive manufacturing design optimization problems through simulations in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can apply DfAM (Design for Additive Manufacturing) principles (subtractive/additive approaches) to simulation tools with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can derive at least three creative design solutions that reflect manufacturing constraints (minimizing support structures, material efficiency, etc.).
Learners can improve their DfAM (Design for Additive Manufacturing) self-efficacy by at least 30% through formative assessment.

resources: DfAM (Design for Additive Manufacturing) Virtual Lab License

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
